org.zamia.instgraph.sim.vcd

Class VCDImport

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.zamia.instgraph.sim.vcd.VCDImport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGISimulator

    public class VCDImport
extends java.lang.Object
implements IGISimulator
    A (at the moment proof-of-concept) simulator plugin that reads simulation data from a VCD file on disk
    Author:
    Guenter Bartsch

      Returns true if this is an interactive simulator (that supports the trace/run/assign and reset methods) or false otherwise (typically a file reader for waveform data)
      void open(ToplevelPath aToplevel, java.io.File aFile, PathName aPrefix, ZamiaProject aZPrj)
      Launch simulator engine on the given design or open the given file, read headers/cache data if necessary.

      For plugins which set isSimulator() to false (importer plugins), a file to import will be provided (other plugins will see a null pointer here).

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open(ToplevelPath aToplevel,
        java.io.File aFile,
        PathName aPrefix,
        ZamiaProject aZPrj)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 ZamiaException
        Description copied from interface: IGISimulator
        Launch simulator engine on the given design or open the given file, read headers/cache data if necessary.

        For plugins which set isSimulator() to false (importer plugins), a file to import will be provided (other plugins will see a null pointer here).

        Specified by:
        open in interface IGISimulator
        Parameters:
        aToplevel - Absolute path of the toplevel corresponding to this simulation
        aFile - File to import (or null if this is a real simulator)
        aPrefix - Prefix to prepend to path names when referring to the file (or null)
        aZPrj - reference to the ZamiaProject this simulation is being performed on
        Throws:
        ZamiaException
        java.io.IOException

      • isSimulator

        public boolean isSimulator()
        Description copied from interface: IGISimulator
        Returns true if this is an interactive simulator (that supports the trace/run/assign and reset methods) or false otherwise (typically a file reader for waveform data)
        Specified by:

        Returns:
